key_facts: Ireland's greenhouse gas emissions in 2023 were the lowest in 30 years.
Ireland's emissions fell by 6.8% overall in 2023.
The energy sector saw a 21.6% drop in emissions.
The energy sector's drop was due to electricity imports and renewables.
The energy sector reduced reliance on fossil fuels.
The drop in agriculture emissions was due to less fertiliser use.
The drop in agriculture emissions was due to fewer livestock.
Milder weather contributed to lower residential emissions.
Rising fuel costs contributed to lower residential emissions.
The EPA acknowledged the emission reductions as climate progress.
The EPA warned Ireland is off track for 2030 climate targets.
Ireland aims to cut emissions by 51% by 2030.
The EPA called for continued momentum and expanded climate measures.
